title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Internet and Software Product Designers

content.rendered:
What is an Internet and Software Product Designer?

Internet and Software Product Designers create digital products such as websites and mobile applications. This job combines knowledge of coding and artistry, as product designers are responsible for the function and look for these products.

Where does an Internet and Software Product Designer work?

  • Tech companies
  • Design companies
  • As a freelance/contract designer (remote)

How much does an Internet and Software Product Designer make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Internet and Software Product Designer is $76,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Internet and Software Product Designer?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Design majors
  • Engineering majors
  • Architecture majors
Search Internet and Software Product Designer jobs

Internet and Software Product Designer skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Internet and Software Product Designers succeed in their work:

  • Ability to collaborate on projects
  • Strong technical knowledge
  • Creativity skills and ability to execute those ideas

What are some common questions about Internet and Software Product Designers?

Q: What technical skills are recommended for Product Design roles?

A: Typically, good technical knowledge of CAD is key. CAD, or computer-aided design, is used heavily in the engineering process.
